Class Directory

  • java.lang.Object
    • FileSystemElement
      • Directory
  • public class Directory
extends FileSystemElement
    A class representing a directory in a file system.

    This class is used to represent a directory in a file system.

    It contains a list of children elements, which can be either files or directories.

    It also contains methods for adding and removing children, as well as sorting them.

    It extends the FileSystemElement class.

    The class has the following methods:

    • Directory(String, Directory): Creates a new directory with a name and a parent directory.
    • Directory(String, Directory, Timestamp): Creates a new directory with a name, a parent directory, and a creation date.
    • add(FileSystemElement): Adds a child element to the directory.
    • remove(FileSystemElement): Removes a child element from the directory.
    • removeRef(FileSystemElement): Removes a single child element from the directory.
    • toString(): Wanted format for printing the directory with '*' and '/'.
    • print(String): Prints the directorys full path to the console.
    • sortByDate(): Sorts the children of the directory by name.
    • getChildren(): Returns the children of the directory.
    • saveElement(PrintWriter): Saves the directory and its children to a file.
    • getChild(String): Returns the child element with the given name.

        public void saveElement​(java.io.PrintWriter writer)

        This method is externalized to the file system.

        I used the ASCII value of ACK character to understand the format of element.

        I add deleting and loading from the file system to make control of the file system.
